final_answer.precision_note: 3 significant figures based on input data precision (25.0 cm3, 0.200 mol dm-3, 250.0 cm3)

method: Use the dilution equation c1V1 = c2V2. Convert volumes from cm3 to dm3: V1 = 25.0 cm3 = 0.0250 dm3, V2 = 250.0 cm3 = 0.250 dm3. Calculate moles of HCl initially: n = c × V = 0.200 × 0.0250 = 0.00500 mol. The total moles remain constant during dilution, so c2 = n / V2 = 0.00500 / 0.250 = 0.0200 mol dm-3.
checks: Final volume is 10× initial volume, so concentration should be 1/10 of original (0.0200 mol dm-3)
Moles are conserved: (0.200 mol/dm3 × 0.0250 dm3) = 0.00500 mol in both cases
